messages.subject: Re: Re: Shimada Kai
messages.msgSnippet: ... Serizawa Kamo I am the bone of my sword. Steel is my body,and fire is my blood. I have created over a thousand blades. Unknown to Death. Nor known to
messages.messageBody:
> > Date: Tue, 26 Dec 2006 04:40:51 -0800 (PST)
> From: Serizawa Kamo <serizawakamo@...>
> Subject: Re: Shimada Kai
> To: No Reply <notify-dg-SHQ@yahoogroups.com>
>
>
> > 3. Shimada Kai
> > Posted by: "Kitsuno"
> > Date: Mon Dec 25, 2006 1:22 am ((PST))
> >
> > I
> > notice on page 33
> > it says that Shimada Kai studied Shinkeito Ryu in
> > Edo, but everywhere
> > else indicates Shingyoto Ryu- was this just a
> > mistake, or is there
> > more to it?
>
> That's just a reading mistake. "Shingyoto-ryu" can
> be
> mistakenly read as "Shinkeito-ryu". But the correct
> pronunciation is "Shingyoto-ryu", created by Iba
> Zesuiken.
>
> Iba Hachiro, a famous swordsmen during the Boshin
> War,
> was one of the most proeminent practitioners of this
> fencing style.


Serizawa Kamo

"I am the bone of my sword.
Steel is my body,and fire is my blood.
I have created over a thousand blades.
Unknown to Death.
Nor known to Life.
Have withstood pain to create many weapons.
Yet, those hands will never hold anyting.
So as I pray, unlimited blade works."

(Fate/Stay Night)

messages.subject: Re: Shimada Kai
messages.messageBody:
Shimada studied Shingyoto-ryu (kenjutsu) and Hozoin-ryu (sojutsu.)

~Seven

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "Kitsuno" <samurai-listowner@...> wrote:
>
> I just got Hillsborough's Shinsengumi book (and still feel somewhat
> violated for paying $30 for a 200 page book) and I notice on page 33
> it says that Shimada Kai studied Shinkeito Ryu in Edo, but everywhere
> else indicates Shingyoto Ryu- was this just a mistake, or is there
> more to it?
>
> As an aside, I found "propensity to kill" 4 times while literally just
> flipping to random pages. I would consider that an error on the part
> of the editor. A somewhat unforgivable one, in fact. Ouch.
>
> I am finding it an interesting read, though, I don't mind the writing
> style.
>

messages.subject: RE: [SHQ] Shimada Kai
messages.msgSnippet: ... He s misreading the gyo of Shingyoto as kei (which is its alternate reading). This isn t an issue of alternate naming, it s an issue of Hillsborough
messages.messageBody:
>it says that Shimada Kai studied Shinkeito Ryu in Edo, but everywhere
>else indicates Shingyoto Ryu- was this just a mistake, or is there
>more to it?

He's misreading the "gyo" of "Shingyoto" as "kei" (which is its alternate
reading). This isn't an issue of alternate naming, it's an issue of
Hillsborough not knowing how to read it properly.

-M.

messages.subject: Shimada Kai
messages.msgSnippet: I just got Hillsborough s Shinsengumi book (and still feel somewhat violated for paying $30 for a 200 page book) and I notice on page 33 it says that Shimada
messages.messageBody:
I just got Hillsborough's Shinsengumi book (and still feel somewhat
violated for paying $30 for a 200 page book) and I notice on page 33
it says that Shimada Kai studied Shinkeito Ryu in Edo, but everywhere
else indicates Shingyoto Ryu- was this just a mistake, or is there
more to it?

As an aside, I found "propensity to kill" 4 times while literally just
flipping to random pages. I would consider that an error on the part
of the editor. A somewhat unforgivable one, in fact. Ouch.

I am finding it an interesting read, though, I don't mind the writing
style.
